Package view

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AchievementPanel  
    Application
    The top level JFrame for the SixesWild game Every other Full screen panel in the game is displayed by adding itself to this JFrame
    BoardPanel
    The Panel that the 9x9 board is displayed on it uses a GroupLayout so that tile positions can be adjusted more accurately
    BucketTilePanel
    The JPanel associated with a Tile that is a bucket Buckets are represented as DARK_GRAY until they are filled, at which point they become LIGHT_GRAY, and indistinguisable from null tiles
    EliminationTopBarPanel
    Each Level type needs to display different information in the top bar Elimination levels need to show how many moves are left
    EndLevelPanel
    The panel displayed when the player finishes a level It contains a message declaring whether the player has won or lost, showing the number of stars they earned, and asking if the want to retry or quit to the main menu
    FillerViewTest  
    GameWestPanel
    This panel goes on the left side of the game screen.
    LevelView
    This is the View the player sees whaen playing the game It contains a top bar that is different depending on the level type It contains the board, with an active controller bound to it that is used to make moves It also contains a GameWestPanel with the progress bar, score milestones, and a restart button
    LightningTopBarPanel
    Each Level type needs to display different information in the top bar Lightning levels need to show the time left and count down each second
    MainMenuView
    The view the player sees when they are at the main menu There are four buttons 1) A button to take them to a PastLevelsView 2) A button to take them to an AchievementsView 3) A button toshow the credits
    NullTilePanel
    NullTilePanel are the TilePanel used for representing NullTileContainers They always appear light grey
    PastLevelButton
    The pastLevelPanel contains one of these buttons for each level if the level is unlocked, it shows the level name and type.
    PastLevelPanel
    The panel that loads when the user clicks the "Levels" button in the main menu It shows all levels, locked or unlocked, each unlocked level is a button that takes you to that level when clicked
    PuzzleTopBarPanel
    Each Level type needs to display different information in the top bar Puzzle levels need to show the movess left
    ReleaseTopBarPanel
    Each Level type needs to display different information in the top bar Release levels need to show the moves left
    SplashPanel
    This splash panel is shown on startup, and also doubles as the credits screen It loads up the Splash screen image in the Images folder
    StarPanel
    A star panel is the panel that shows how many stars a player has earned.
    TilePanel
    The Panel that represents a NumberTileContainer in the board It is green, (turns slightly lighter when marked in an elimination level) It shows the Tile number and multiplier (if the TileContainer is not empty)
